An Axis Of Perdition.title: Apertures
An Axis Of Perdition.about:
An Axis of Perdition's journey is a compelling saga of evolution and experimentation within the industrial extreme metal landscape. Formed in the early 2000s, the band harnessed their experiences with mental illness and the unsettling backdrop of Middlesbrough to craft a sound that melds dissonance with visceral intensity. Their early releases, like The Ichneumon Method and Deleted Scenes From The Transition Hospital, showcased their ability to blend harsh industrial elements with intricate metal compositions, earning them critical acclaim and a devoted following. The ambitious concept albums Urfe and Tenements pushed the boundaries even further, weaving a nightmarish narrative that reflected their unique aesthetic. After a brief hiatus and eventual dissolution, the duo's return in 2019 marked a resurgence of creativity, culminating in the 2024 release of Apertures. This album not only encapsulates their signature sound but also pushes into new realms of surrealism and atmospheric depth. With their recent partnership with Apocalyptic Witchcraft, An Axis of Perdition continues to redefine their musical landscape, offering listeners a haunting and immersive experience that remains distinctively their own.
Michael Blenkarn-Durning comments:
"An Axis of Perdition are delighted to join forces with Apocalyptic Witchcraft - a fresh and vital voice for quality new extreme music. We look forward to toxifying ears and minds worldwide with their connivance, long past the point where they bitterly regret it (if they do not already)."

trackinfo.title: Corrupted Pulse
trackinfo.credits: from Apertures, released December 13, 2024

trackinfo.title: Metempsychosis
trackinfo.lyrics: Will you meet my gaze  Through your bleared mucosa?  Conjoined as we have become  Daubed with cauls of phlegm  The cloying residuum   Of the mutability of the flesh  The repulsive stigmata that mark us   As damned    Contagion ascendant  Our minds are hollowed inside out  By predatory thoughts  That gorge themselves upon our memories  And gnaw on the gristle of our sanity   I feel their larvae writhe  Beneath the fragile blistered skin   Of gossamer unconsciousness  Like a foul vestigial twin  A tumescent psychogenic growth  With agglomerated eyes   This canker feigns quiescence  But its pallid eyelids flutter  Behold as it stirs from its torpor  With a slack and toothless maw    To distend the birthing sac   Of a world that should not be  You cannot unsee  Your psyche’s abhorrent progeny  Beneath the membrane of the abhumane   Your dislocated eyes are open  This mingling can never be denied  Your mouth is always open   You cannot unsee   Your psyche’s aberrant effigy
trackinfo.credits: from Apertures, released December 13, 2024

trackinfo.title: The Undercity Awaits
trackinfo.credits: from Apertures, released December 13, 2024

trackinfo.title: Chant Of The Worshipful Prey
trackinfo.lyrics: The wretched innocence   You chose to squander  Is trodden down   Into the dirt  Over-ripened pleasures   Steeped in guilt  In abnegation’s mire  A calumny awaits  For the prey that squirm  In the throes of their abjection  The dissipation of their hopes  Nothing is immune to this ennui  Nothing  Scoured unclean by this anaesthesis   The numb aseptic bliss of dis-completion  Nothing is immune to this ennui  Nothing  The essence of the blemish   On flyspecked epidermis  Nameless curvatures   Dissimulating sensuality   Disgorging disease  The mark of the soiled  Condemned as Pariahs  Anathema, spoiled   Drowning in dark  And flensed by dismay  Our weakening flesh  Is afire with decay  Suspended in a cataract of dark  The grim viscosity of gods  In the fathomless abyss   Of intolerable formlessness  Nothing is but skin on skin  Alive with interpermeation  Through black apertures of distended space  Our bodies fall through yours   Nothing is immune to this ennui  Nothing
trackinfo.credits: from Apertures, released December 13, 2024

trackinfo.title: Sewer Of Lethe
trackinfo.credits: from Apertures, released December 13, 2024

trackinfo.title: The Truth Is There To Tear Apart
trackinfo.lyrics: The truth is there   To tear apart  Exsanguinate and purge   The scourge of being  Insidious black light corrupts  Disgorging spores that seed  Our misery  The ashes of those who died first   A corrosive miasma that chokes  Sears through the flesh of my hands  And blackens my eyes and my throat  The truth is there   To tear apart  Exsanguinate and purge   The scourge of being  Insidious black light corrupts  Disgorging spores that seed  Our misery  In this pestilential mire  Self-dehumanised and scorned  My poisoned blood mingles with the effluent   As I submerge myself in sludge  In my heart I know  As spoilage fills my eyes and mouth  It didn't have to be like this  This viscous tar of debilitating shame   But the truth is there   To tear apart  Exsanguinate and purge   The scourge of being  Insidious black light corrupts  Disgorging spores that blight
trackinfo.credits: from Apertures, released December 13, 2024

trackinfo.title: Unimaginable Depths
trackinfo.credits: from Apertures, released December 13, 2024

trackinfo.title: Private Acts Of Abnegation
trackinfo.lyrics: In the grip of recrimination  I claw myself in spirals  With sclerotic, failing limbs  That cannot bear this burden  On these abraded stumps  Of amputated self  Featureless and vague  Like so much mangled clay  Unearth traumatic truth  Exhume these welted clods   Severed shreds of memory  Stitched disfigured guilt  Embrace malformity  Clawed free from the tatters of sanity  A shrivelled denuded mind  Charred by desperation   Sear from my eyes  These polluted visions   Fear of the flesh  That is my noxious prison   Scarred and repellent  The embodiment of loathing  I cannot bear this form   Vitiated husks   Alike in castigation    The homunculi of taint  Bathe willingly in spoilage  Black humiliation  Corroding dignity  The all-corrupting blight  That coats my throat forever   Deeper down  Further in  Darker depths  Blacker sins  Failure's weight  Drags me down  Broken willed  Ashen crowned  I cannot bear this form...
trackinfo.credits: from Apertures, released December 13, 2024

trackinfo.title: Flesh Underfoot
trackinfo.credits: from Apertures, released December 13, 2024

trackinfo.title: I Am Odium
trackinfo.lyrics: Shame is a womb  Gravid with tumescence  From which my stillborn future peers  Blackened with grime  A foulness unassuaged  Bruised with cruelty and neglect  Never dealt the true extent   Of the punishment it earned  Relive it now, the compulsion overwhelming   The taste of ruination in my throat   The greasy mouthfeel of corruption   Malign euphoria of self-betrayal  And all that I’ve learned  Is that this will never end   For as long as I still breathe   A mannequin of filth  Crawling with the larvae of obscenity   Prostrate in abasement  Unclean and abhorrent and vile  Encaged in this wreckage   The body and mind I defiled  And so it shall remain  The torment of embodiment  The alienation of the flesh  I am odium, indelibly disgraced  And mottled with the pockmarks of reproach  And all that I’ve learned  Is that this will never end   For as long as I still breathe  A mannequin of filth  Crawling with the larvae of obscenity, I rise   I rise!
trackinfo.credits: from Apertures, released December 13, 2024

An Axis Of Perdition.title: Effluvia
An Axis Of Perdition.about:
Created in 2012 using reconfigured and remixed material from the ‘Urfe’ album and the sessions from which it arose, ‘Effluvia’ presents three immersive ambient excursions into the damaged landscape of Locus Eyrie. The sounds of ‘Urfe’ mingle here, nurtured and reshaped, transgressing the relations the album had established, interjected with the wreckage that might have been. As such it presents an alternative aperture to that traumatic world without its guiding voice, shedding light onto its twisted underbelly.
Secreted jealously by the band in the years since as their own private umbilicus to the unique headspace that existed around the making of that album, they now offer it up to public view, as a window to peer from the contemporary vantage of self-isolation into the hidden depths of a darker place.
An Axis Of Perdition.credits:
released March 31, 2020
Michael Blenkarn
Brooke Johnson
Leslie Simpson

An Axis Of Perdition.title: Tenements (of the Anointed Flesh)
An Axis Of Perdition.label: Aural Music
An Axis Of Perdition.about:
File under: Industrial Black Metal
Info: “Tenements…” is an album that cuts to the very heart of The Axis Of Perdition and exposes the diseased core with a violence, depth and derangement that is so far unmatched in the band's discography. Haunting, moving, excruciating and excoriating in equal measure, it is an album that demands attention from start to finish and will leave no listener untouched.
"If you like experimental, atmospheric, industrial, progressive black metal and you like it to sound like it's crawling out of the sewers, look for this."
Don't count on it - 9,5/10
"As always, Tenements succeeds through pure overwhelming force, beating the listener into a state of slack-jawed submission as it pours in the poisons through the porches of the ears."
Metal Review - 8,7/10

An Axis Of Perdition.title: Urfe
An Axis Of Perdition.label: Aural Music
An Axis Of Perdition.about:
File Under: Axis is glyph. Logos of abomination. Neither life nor death, between the many ciphers of absence
Info: Urfe is a broken man, just one despairing voice among the multitude of lost souls in the doomed nowhere town of Locus Eyrie. Coerced into a quest for answers by an anonymous letter, Urfe is drawn into a waking nightmare where the shadows of his past shape a reality that is rapidly disintegrating around him. Hounded ever further into his self-made hell by the wretched denizens of the dark, and tempted ever onward by the enigmatic Pylon, Urfe discovers that salvation and healing come at a cost so desperate that neither can be trusted for what they seem.Urfe, the new album from The Axis Of Perdition, finds the band deeper into their idiosyncratic vision than ever before. A labyrinthine journey through the dark terrain of their subconscious, Urfe draws on a wealth of classic industrial, dark ambient and cinematic music and threads it together with a fevered, psychedelic part-narrative part-poetic performance from actor Leslie Simpson (Dog Soldiers, The Descent, Doomsday, Beyond The Rave). The result is their most harrowing, dysfunctional and personal album to date, drawing musical influence from Swans, Godflesh, Esoteric, Angelo Badalamenti and the finest of Industrial music from Throbbing Gristle onwards. With Urfe, The Axis Of Perdition transcend their humble origins and make music that is both their most uncompromising and their finest.

An Axis Of Perdition.title: Chained in the Damnation Asylum
An Axis Of Perdition.about:
“The Ichneumon Method” turns twenty years old today and in the absence of a moist outpouring of glistening new larvae, we present the hitherto unreleased (or perhaps, hitherto lodged in its birthing wound) album version of “Chained In The Damnation Asylum”, which was amputated from the final album for reasons best not dwelt upon.
The mixing and mastering of the song have been ably remoistened and jiggled in the slick hands of our longstanding advocate Saulius Bielskis (of the mighty Haeiresis, Velemara and Sisyphean), who surely regrets ever meeting us by now.
The artwork, similar, is drawn from the same sludgeheap of dysfunctional Photoshopery that spawned the original sleeve, though we have felt obliged to begrime it further in order to smear away some of the pixellation, which is hardly a good look in 2023.
An Axis of Perdition continue to ignore everyone’s pleas for us to stop being sick in their ears.
An Axis Of Perdition.credits:
released April 28, 2023
Dr Michael Blenkarn-Durning - Guitars, Programming, Synth
Dr Brooke Johnson - Vocals, Bass, Samples
